vote.title:
Adoption of the 2026-2027 Health Benefits Agreement
Office of Labor Relations
vote.description:
Title
Adoption of the 2026-2027 Health Benefits Agreement
Office of Labor Relations
end
 
Brief Description:
description
(Adoption of the 2026-2027 Health Benefits Agreement) Recommends adoption of the 2026-2027 Health Benefits Agreement (Attachment A) between the Los Angeles Unified School District (“District”) and Unions/Associations Representing District Employees (“Unions”) (collectively “Parties”) inclusive of Associated Administrators of Los Angeles/Teamsters Local 2010, California School Employees Association, and its Los Angeles Chapter 500, Los Angeles/Orange Counties Building and Construction Trades Council, Los Angeles School Police Association, Los Angeles School Police Management Association, SEIU Local 99, Teamsters Local 572, and United Teachers Los Angeles. This Agreement is being presented to the Board of Education as a joint recommendation by all of the Parties. This Agreement is being adopted subject to any requisite union procedures that each respective union(s)/association(s) may need to comply with in order to secure the approval and ratification of its membership, and is conditioned on and subject to the Los Angeles County Office of Education’s (LACOE) certification of the District’s AB 1200 Form for Public Disclosure Report (AB 1200 Report) and 2026-2027 Health Benefits Agreement. 
end
 
Recommendation
Action Proposed: 
Adoption of the 2026-2027 Health Benefits Agreement (Attachment A) between the Los Angeles Unified School District (“District”) and Unions/Associations Representing District Employees (“Unions”) (collectively “Parties”) inclusive of Associated Administrators of Los Angeles /Teamsters Local 2010, California School Employees Association, and its Los Angeles Chapter 500, Los Angeles/Orange Counties Building and Construction Trades Council, Los Angeles School Police Association, Los Angeles School Police Management Association, SEIU Local 99, Teamsters Local 572, and United Teachers Los Angeles.  This Agreement is being presented to the Board of Education as a joint recommendation by all of the Parties. This Agreement is being adopted subject to any requisite union procedures that each respective union(s)/association(s) may need to comply with in order to secure the approval and ratification of its membership and is conditioned on and subject to LACOE’s certification of the District’s AB 1200 Report and 2026-2027 Health Benefits Agreement. If LACOE does not certify the District’s AB 1200 Report for this Agreement, they may require the District to make budget adjustments to ensure financial stability or negotiations may need to resume between the parties.
end
 
Body
Background: 
The District engaged in negotiations with representatives of our eight labor partners, who represent the interests of benefit-eligible employees. The parties have reached a two-year agreement, covering the period commencing on January 1, 2026, through December 31, 2027. Copies of the Agreement are available for public review through the Office of Labor Relations.
 
Expected Outcomes:
Adoption of the 2026-2027 Health Benefits Agreement will allow for the continuation of current health benefits for employees, retirees, and their eligible dependents. The adoption of the Agreement is subject to any requisite union procedures that each respective union(s)/association(s) may need to comply with in order to secure the approval and ratification of its membership and is conditioned on and subject to LACOE’s certification of the District’s AB 1200 Report and 2026-2027 Health Benefits Agreement. 
 
Board Options and Consequences: 
If the Board adopts the attached 2026-2027 Health Benefits Agreement between the District and the Unions and LACOE certifies the District’s AB 1200 Report, this Agreement, which is a joint recommendation of the bargaining parties, will be implemented and health benefits will continue to be provided as they are currently. 
 
If the Board does not adopt the 2026-2027 Health Benefits Agreement, the parties would resume negotiations.
 
Policy Implications: 
This Agreement becomes policy upon adoption by the Board, subject to any requisite union procedures that each respective union(s)/association(s) may need to comply with in order to secure the approval and ratification of its membership. This agreement is pending AB 1200 certification by LACOE. If LACOE does not certify the District’s AB 1200 Report, they may require the District to make budget adjustments to ensure financial stability or negotiations may need to resume between the parties.
 
Budget Impact: 
The budget impact for this agreement is approximately $3.1 billion over two years, as detailed in the attached AB 1200 Report, which is pending LACOE certification.
 
Student Impact:
This Agreement will assist the District in recruiting and retaining highly qualified staff with superior health and welfare benefits. Students will benefit from fully staffed schools and offices.
 
Equity Impact:
The equity impact for this agreement is detailed below:
 



Component

 Score 

Score Rationale



Recognition

    1

Health Benefits are applied to all employees, retirees, and their eligible dependents.



Resource Prioritization

    3

This Agreement, in providing for high quality health benefits, greatly assists employees in protecting/maintaining higher levels of personal health and wellness, facilitating circumstances for employees to capably serve students effectively, improving student outcomes.



Results

    2

Health Benefits for all employees, retirees, and their dependents will attract and retain talented staff with background, education, and desire necessary to address opportunity and/or achievement gaps.



TOTAL

    6

 


 
Issues and Analysis: 
This Health Benefits Agreement concludes bargaining between the District and its eight labor partners, who represent the interests of benefit-eligible employees, relating to health benefits provided between January 1, 2026, through December 31, 2027. The implementation of this agreement is conditioned on and subject to LACOE’s certification of the District’s AB 1200 Report and 2026-2027 Health Benefits Agreement. If LACOE does not certify the District’s AB 1200 Report for this Agreement, they may require the District to make budget adjustments to ensure financial stability or negotiations may need to resume between the parties.
 
Attachments:
Attachment A - 2026-2027 Health Benefits Agreement
Attachment B - AB 1200 Report
 
Submitted:
12/05/25
